co2SensorKeyFeatures.heading: Key features of the CO2 sensor

accuracy.title: Unmatched Accuracy
accuracy.description: Our CO2 sensor offers the high accuracy for the CO2 concentration readings with a 1 PPM resolution.

longTerm.title: Long-term working power
longTerm.description: The robust NDIR technology in our sensor ensures the long-term performance with less drift over time.

smallSize.title: Smaller in size
smallSize.description: Its size makes our CO2 sensor easy to install in any system or device and make it portable for easy installation.

adaptability.title: Any environment adaptability
adaptability.description: Our CO2 sensor is suitable for various applications like air quality monitors, greenhouses, HVAC systems etc.

calibration.title: Auto and manual calibration
calibration.description: Our CO2 sensor offers the automatic and manual calibration function to maintain better accuracy in different condition.

signalOutput.title: Signal output PWM/UART
signalOutput.description: This sensor supports 2 advanced CO2 data output formats for easy data transfer and compatibility with multiple platforms.

description.part1: Our carbon dioxide (CO2) sensors are based on
description.part2: , which stands for Non-Dispersive Infrared radiation. This procedure is commonly used to detect carbon-based gases in the atmosphere, such as CO2.

co2SensorWhyNecessary.heading: Why is it necessary to monitor carbon dioxide gas?
co2SensorWhyNecessary.description: Carbon dioxide is a gas exhaled by human beings as a part of their respiration process. As the population grows and the number of individuals per square foot rises, CO2 concentrations can be substantially higher indoors than they are outside. The usual CO2 level in outdoor air is 400 parts per million or ppm, and it is now growing at a rate of 2 ppm every year. Indoors, due to stuffy rooms or insufficient ventilation,

crucial.title: Why is Monitoring CO₂ Crucial?
crucial.subtitle: Excess CO₂ in enclosed spaces can lead to:

item1.title: Reduced Alertness:
item1.description: High CO₂ levels impair focus and productivity.

item2.title: Health Issues
item2.description: Long-term exposure impacts respiratory health and cognitive functions.

item3.title: Poor Indoor Comfort
item3.description: Stale air contributes to discomfort and fatigue.

co2SensorCalibration.heading: Sensor Calibration
co2SensorCalibration.description: Prana Air sensors are calibrated by the zero-point calibration method. This method reveals a range of measurements of the instrument. The zero point for sensor calibration is 400 ppm and the calibration cycle is of 96 hours (4 days) duration.
